name: Matt Currier
bio: A versatile engineering leader and eclecticist with a passion for innovation.  Currently a Director of Engineering, Matt combines expertise in control systems, full stack development, embedded systems, and IT infrastructure with an R&D mindset.  His background spans engineering leadership, hardware, firmware and software development, and professional musicianship, reflecting an ethos of creativity meets technology.

projects.title: Poemia
projects.description: An innovative AI ghostwriting product enabling unique forms of story-telling.

projects.title: Spectrum
projects.description: An interactiv, reactive osteogenic system that visualizes force production.

projects.title: OsteoStrong Automation Systems
projects.description: Developed health automation systems for OsteoStrong’s osteogenic loading equipment. Integrated sensors, PLCs, and software to automate strength training devices, improving safety and tracking performance data.

projects.title: MCP/Codex Enterprise Architecture
projects.description: Led an enterprise architecture initiative combining Model Context Protocol (MCP) with AI code generation (Codex). Built a platform to streamline enterprise software development by integrating AI-driven tools into the workflow.

experience.title: Director of Engineering
experience.responsibilities: Leading the engineering team and R&D efforts for an AI-powered development platform. Architecting solutions that integrate model context protocols and AI (Codex) to automate and enhance software development workflows.

experience.title: Lead Automation Engineer (Consultant)
experience.responsibilities: Designed and implemented automated control systems for OsteoStrong’s bone-strengthening equipment. Developed firmware and PLC programs to control high-impact training devices, improving safety features and data collection.

experience.title: Founder & Engineer
experience.responsibilities: Pursued independent tech projects including 'Poemia' and 'Spectrum'. Handled end-to-end development from concept to prototype, covering hardware design, software/firmware development, and integration of creative feedback.
